alert.note: Alert for Martin; Okeechobee; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 1:07PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern St. Lucie, southeastern Okeechobee and Martin Counties through 145 PM EST... At 106 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 6 miles east of South Beach to 6 miles northwest of Tradition to near Buckhead Ridge. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart and Treasure Island. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
